data.title: Kissflow Reviews, Pricing & Features - 2024
data.meta_description: Evaluate, compare & learn more about Kissflow. Get features lists, pricing, reviews, demos & reseller information.
data.text:
Kissflow Overview

Kissflow is a business process management (BPM) software published by OrangeScape Technologies, an Indian software company with offices in the US, UK, India and Singapore. Kissflow targets mid-market and enterprise organizations across various industries looking to streamline workflows and business processes. It is available as both a cloud-based and on-premise solution with infrastructure requirements varying by deployment size.

There are three editions of Kissflow - Starter, Pro and Enterprise. Key capabilities include workflow automation, forms and reporting, collaboration, integration, analytics and more. The software works across desktop, mobile, Windows and Mac devices. OrangeScape offers online, phone and 24/7 chat support.

Kissflow Key Features and Modules - Whatâ€™s included?

Key modules and capabilities:

Workflow Automation - Build rule-based workflows to streamline business processes with drag and drop simplicity

Forms & Reporting - Create custom forms and generate reports for data insights

Collaboration - Features like chat and task management for improved teamwork

Integration - Pre-built connectors and APIs to integrate with other systems

Analytics - Dashboards and analytics for monitoring workflows and identifying bottlenecks

Mobile Access - Native iOS and Android apps so employees can work on the go

Security - Granular access controls, encryption, data privacy controls and more

Kissflow can integrate with common tools like Office 365, G Suite, Salesforce, SharePoint and more. When evaluating BPM software, automation capabilities, ease of use and mobile access are key factors to consider. Kissflow is highly flexible and user-friendly compared to alternatives.

Benefits of Kissflow

Kissflow delivers significant time and cost savings through streamlined operations. Workflow automation eliminates repetitive manual tasks while forms and reporting provide real-time visibility into processes. This ultimately drives higher productivity and efficiency. Key benefits include:

Market DifferentiatorBenefitsIntuitive interfaceEasy for non-technical users to build workflows without codingFlexible workflowsModel complex processes with rules, conditional logic etc for robust automationMobile capabilitiesWorkflows available on native iOS and Android apps for on-the-go accessAnalyticsEmbedded analytics provide insights into bottlenecks and performanceAffordable pricingCost-effective automation for mid-market companies compared to competitors Industry solutionsPre-configured templates for industries like finance, healthcare etc

Kissflow Pricing

Kissflow uses a tiered per user per month subscription model. There are three pricing tiers based on features - Starter, Pro and Enterprise. More advanced capabilities and support are offered at higher tiers while lower tiers serve basic needs.

It's important to consider the number of users that will require access and the complexity of your workflows when budgeting. While Kissflow has a lower entry price than some BPM tools targeting enterprises, advanced use cases may still require higher investments. The potential productivity gains and operations efficiency should outweigh software costs over time.

Kissflow Reviews

Based on over 700 customer reviews on Gartner Peer Insights, Kissflow receives an overall rating of 4.5 out of 5 stars. The positive feedback highlights the software's intuitive drag-and-drop interface, comprehensive feature set, and strong workflow automation capabilities. Users mention building complex workflows with ease and appreciating the ability to make changes quickly. Negative feedback centers around some limitations with integrations, mobile access, and occasional bugs needing to be worked out.

Software analysts see Kissflow as a leader in the BPM software space with a focus on collaboration and ease-of-use. While not as extensive as some competitor products, Kissflow provides robust workflow functionality targeted at small-to-medium businesses. Analysts view the company's cloud-based offering and affordable pricing as differentiators in the market.

Kissflow Advantages

Key advantages of Kissflow highlighted by customers and analysts include:

Intuitive interface - The drag-and-drop workflow builder allows non-technical users to easily automate processes without coding.

Comprehensive features - Kissflow provides a wide range of workflow and collaboration features out-of-the-box to streamline processes.

Affordable pricing - Kissflow offers flexible plans at competitive prices, making it accessible for SMBs.

Cloud-based access - Users can access Kissflow from anywhere via the cloud rather than needing on-premise infrastructure.

Strong support - Knowledgeable support reps provide guidance on setup and using Kissflow's features.

Third-party integrations - 150+ pre-built integrations with apps like Office 365, G Suite, Salesforce and more.

Customizable platform - Users can easily tailor workflows, forms, dashboards and reports to their needs.

Mobile optimization - Native mobile apps enable users to access and manage workflows on-the-go.

Kissflow Disadvantages

Potential downsides to evaluate include:

Steep learning curve - With its broad feature set, Kissflow can have a learning curve for some new users to leverage its full capabilities.

Complex workflows - Handling extremely complex workflows may require involvement from Kissflow's professional services team.

Limited analytics - Basic analytics and reporting may not be as robust as some competing solutions.

Occasional stability issues - Some users have encountered bugs with new feature releases before fixes roll out.

Limited brand awareness - As a smaller vendor, Kissflow lacks the brand recognition of larger players like Pega and Appian.

Support responsiveness - Support response times have occasionally lagged for some customers during peak times.

Third-party dependency - Reliance on 150+ third-party integrations means potential issues outside Kissflow's control.

Is Kissflow For You?

For SMBs and mid-market companies seeking an intuitive, affordable BPM platform, Kissflow represents a strong option to consider. The software stands out through its ease-of-use, customizability and focus on collaboration. While not as robust as more expensive competitors, Kissflow provides comprehensive workflow automation capabilities targeted at the needs of growing organizations.

As with any software purchase, organizations must evaluate their specific needs and requirements to determine the best fit. With over 30 years of experience guiding customers in software selection, the experts at Technology Evaluation Centers stand ready to advise you on whether Kissflow or alternative solutions are optimal to achieve your business goals. Contact us today to get started on finding the right BPM platform for your organization.
